breweries.name: Laht Neppur Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We couldn't have said it better ourselves. Laht Neppur Brewing Co., located in Waitsburg, WA, offers premium handcrafted ale by the glass or pitcher in our tap room. Sampler trays are highly recommended for first time visitors. We also have Mason Jars, Growlers, and Party Pigs to go.

After home brewing for more than 20 years, Chiefton Brewer Court Ruppenthal, came to the Walla Walla Valley to learn the art of wine making. He quickly realized that what the valley really needed was beer - good beer. After all, winemakers in the valley are often heard saying, "It takes a lot of beer to make good wine." So he decided to open his own brewery, and opened the doors to the public on June 3, 2006.

All Laht Neppur beer is produced on site and is available in our tap room. There are no macro-brews here! Families are welcome, and we offer an outdoor seating area.

style.name: Golden or Blonde Ale

breweries.name: Beaver's Bend Brewery
breweries.description:
Beavers Bend Brewery has been the longtime dream of Steve Bartholomew, Brad Reesing and Greg Campbell. We are committed to bringing top quality craft brewing to Southeastern Oklahoma.
Bartholomew and Reesing have more than 35 years of experience brewing beer, honing their craft in a wide range of styles. Our brews are available now at Grateful Head & Abendigo's, both in Hochatown, with more locations coming soon. BBB features both year-round and seasonal brews; Hoppin' Howlapeno Ale, Red Slough Amber, Our blonde ale, Fleucy Creek Pale Ale, Front Porch Peach Ale and our fall pumpkin seasonal ale. 
We hope you enjoy our craft beer as much as we enjoy creating it.
Cheers Ya'll!

breweries.name: Blind Squirrel
breweries.description: The Vance Toe River Lodge was originally built in 1919 as the T. B. Vance General Store. After trading hands through the years and seeing its fair share of abuse it was renovated by the Young family and continues to evolve.  With that evolution came the expansion of our  “Lodge Family”.  When Aaron Maas moved to Plumtree, NC in 2009 as an avid home brewer, the dream to open a brewery slowly moved towards reality.  After 3 painstaking years, the brewery finally opened in July of 2012.  We are excited to be able to live in such a wonderful place and still have the ability to follow our passions.  Come out to Plumtree so we can prove to you that we’re nuts about beer!!

breweries.name: Sierra Nevada Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Sierra Nevada Brewing Company was established in 1980 by homebrewers Ken Grossman and Paul Camusi. Camusi retired in 1998 and sold his share in the company to Grossman.

Located in Chico, California, Sierra Nevada Brewing is one of the most popular craft breweries currently operating in the United States. Its Pale Ale is world renowned, and the brewery produces almost 700,000 barrels of beer per year. Sierra Nevada's Pale Ale is the second best-selling craft beer in the United States, behind the Boston Beer Company's Samuel Adams Boston Lager.

Sierra Nevada's specialty brews include the winter seasonal Celebration, which is similar to the pale ale, but hoppier; and Summerfest, a lager which is citrusy and sunny.

breweries.name: Fat Head's Brewery
breweries.description: Fat Head's was founded in 1992 as a premiere craft beer tap house and restaurant in Pittsburgh, PA. In 2009 we expanded to Ohio and teamed up with our award-winning Head Brewmaster. With the explosion in popularity came the necessity to open a full-scale production brewery in 2012. Fat Head's Brewery produces original ales and lagers for distribution throughout Ohio and Western Pennsylvania.

data.name: Barba Tart Blonde Ale
data.description: Barba is inspired by the German Gose ales but uses no lactobacillus to achieve its refreshing balance between salty and tart. Brewed with German wheat, grey sea salt, tangerine zest and rhubarb, fermented in a concrete tank, and cold conditioned for 2 weeks prior to packaging, Barba is a complex yet highly drinkable blonde ale.

data.name: Bare Ass Blonde
data.description: First brewed in 1996 as part of our original line-up, and still available year round, Bare Ass Blonde Ale is undisputed as our most popular beer. Is it all in the name? No! (Well, the name doesn’t hurt) Our smoothly drinkable little blonde bombshell will turn your head with her smooth, light malt flavor, mild hop character, and crisp, refreshing, fruity finish. But don’t let the innocent look fool you. She’s got a way of stripping away all pretense with her 5% abv and getting right to the naked truth.

breweries.name: DuClaw Brewing Company
breweries.description: At DuClaw Brewing Company, we are very proud of our beers. Our beers have received their fair share of recognition over the years, but even though we put quality first, fun is never far behind ... just look at the names of our beers. How do we come up with them? All we have to say is that there is a whole lot of creativity in those vats of beer just dying to come out, and we never stop till we get it right.

data.name: Bareback Blonde Ale
data.description: This strong blonde ale is brewed with wheat and citrusy west coast hops to give it a crisp, refreshing and flavorful profile that is aimed to please craft beer enthusiasts and occasional beer drinkers alike. The initial sweetness is balanced out by a bright hop aroma with hints of lemon peel and finishes very cleanly.

breweries.name: Mother Earth Brew Company
breweries.description:
In early 2010, Mother Earth launched a unique brewing supply store and tasting room at its new Vista, CA location. Just a half mile from the 78 freeway and just minutes from the I-5, Mother Earth Brew Co. is right in the middle of the "North County Beer Triangle" in North San Diego County. 

Our business caters to home brewers seeking the highest quality, freshest ingredients and to people who enjoy sampling great beers - many of which are exclusively available at our tasting bar! Come on by for a truly unique experience, and always remember...Love Your Mother!

breweries.name: Barley Brothers Restaurant & Brewery
breweries.description:
Barley Brothers restaurant and brewery is an upscale-casual eatery known for its extensive menu, great music, and award winning draft beer. From classic lagers to more obscure ales and stouts there's a draft beer flavor for everyone. Our American cuisine menu includes an impressive selection of appetizers, salads, pastas, sandwiches, wood fired pizzas, ribs and rotisserie chicken. Barley Brothers plays America’s favorite - classic rock and an abundance of flat screens showcase the day's sports and special events.

Barley Brothers is part of the Shugrues Restaurant and Brewery Group. Restaurants are located Lake Havasu City, and Sedona Arizona.

There is something for everyone at the Barley Brothers.

breweries.name: Acorn Brewery of Barnsley
breweries.description:
Established in May 2003 by former chef Dave Hughes and his wife Judi, Acorn Brewery is located to the east of the Pennines in the village of Wombwell, Barnsley.

Having worked for Barnsley Brewery as Head Brewer for two years, Dave decided to go it alone, purchased a ten barrel brewplant from the Forester & Firkin brewpub in Stafford and moved it to premises in Wombwell.

 Following a lot of hard work by Dave and his assistant brewer Steve Bunting, and despite some initial set backs, the brewplant was commissioned and production of Acorn Brewery Barnsley Bitter began on 4th July 2003, using the same yeast strain as the original Barnsley Brewery, founded in the 1850's. Since then, sales have grown steadily and the range of beers has increased.

Acorn Brewery has developed a popular Yorkshire brand and is currently supplying over 300 free trade outlets and 3 national wholesalers.  

There are currently three award-winning beers permanently available, as well as regular seasonal brews.

breweries.name: McKenzie Brewing Company
breweries.description:
All of our beers are brewed in very small batches so they are always fresh and at their peak. Our brewers consistently bring home awards from the Great American Beer Festival, 24 medals so far. Our award-winning beers are brewed at all three locations, where our brewers strive to push the creative envelope.  Our beer selection is both consistent, with four flagship brands, and fresh with new offerings of seasonal and dark beers.

Unfortunately we can not go under the Steelhead name due to Trademark issues so we will be McKenzie Brewing Company.

data.name: BarrelHouse Blonde Ale
data.description: Even at 5.0% ABV this blonde is pumped full of delicious flavor. This is a craft beer drinker’s blonde. We brew it with nearly all Mosaic hops and just enough IBU’s for those that appreciate hops but not too over-powering for those looking for something drinkable. This beer imparts huge citrus and fruit character while finishing slightly sweet and ends clean.

breweries.name: BarrelHouse Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Barrelhouse Brewing Co. is nestled in the rolling hills of San Luis Obispo County on the edge of Paso Robles and in the heart of wine country…what will our neighbors think?

As you turn off Ramada Drive and onto Marquita Way, you will meander around a majestic oak tree.  This majestic white oak stands in the middle of where the road would have gone, if not for this tree’s historical significance.  If you look closely at the trunk of this old oak, you will notice the mark of an equal armed cross carved into its bark. The cross was carved sometime between 1775 and 1776 when Spanish Lt. Colonel Juan Batista de Anza led more than 240 men, women and children on an overland journey from the frontier New Spain to settle in Alta California. During that 1,200 mile journey, the very thirsty Colonel carved the cross to signify the perfect location for a brewery…well, that’s our story at Barrelhouse and we can’t exactly prove it, but we’re sticking to it!  Historians believe that Juan Batista de Anza or someone on his team carved the cross to indicate a safe place to camp.  We think it makes a sweet logo, too!

After you pass the old oak, make a left on Limestone Way and look for the dragon fly…you can’t miss it. 

Stop by, grab a brew or two and relax.  Enjoy our glorious beer gardens with friends while you listen to the waterfall and experience the central coast the way it was meant to be enjoyed…outside.  You can also pull up to the bar inside the brewery where you’ll feel like you’re part of the brewing action. Along with our amazing line-up of beers, we will also feature our very own custom crafted rootbeers.  If you ask nicely, we can even float a scoop of ice cream in your favorite sarsaparilla or stout.

data.name: Barstool
data.description: Not too malty, not too hoppy, Barstool is designed for a night out with your friends. Our flagship beer is handcrafted with the freshest ingredients, including two-row barley and specialty malts. A blend of English and Czech hops top off this delicious golden ale, which can be enjoyed for hours on end.

breweries.name: Next Door Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Next Door Brewing Company is a brewery and restaurant for our community.  We serve the best beer and food we can provide while offering a convivial environment for our customers to enjoy a great conversation over a drink and snack or meal with family, friends and neighbors — old and new.

Our beer is handcrafted in small batches and served just a few yards from where it was brewed.  Expect to find 8 to 11 choices at any time, ranging from our standards, Wilbur!, WPA and Sevex to a wide variety of seasonal, creative and collaborative brews (including a new brand of brews every 10-14 days).  And, we proudly pour a full pint.

breweries.description:
At Artisan's Brewery, "Beer is Art".
Our Brewmaster Dave Hoffman hand selects hops and malted barley from only quality suppliers.

All of our beers are handcrafted in the on premise Brewery, made from our Brewmaster’s own recipes.

We proudly brew a variety of traditional beer styles and more distinctive specialty ales and lagers.

breweries.name: MobCraft Beer
breweries.description:
MOBCRAFT IS THE WORLD’S FIRST COMPLETELY CROWDSOURCED BREWERY!

MobCraft Beer is a small craft brewery making custom craft beer. We produce small batch “custom craft beers” based off of users submitted recipes and ideas which end up in our recipe vault. Each month, you can vote on a wide variety of beer styles and flavors. Cast your vote by pre-ordering the beer you want us to brew. MobCraft will produce the beer with the most orders and ship out a 4 pack of 22oz “bomber” bottles to your doorstep! Or if you're near the brewery come pick it up in our tap room location in Madison, WI!

breweries.name: Tapistry Brewing
breweries.description: Tapistry Brewing has one goal: creating excellent craft beer. Whether it’s a classic English robust porter or an experimental dark smoked imperial saison, we craft our beverages with purpose, conviction and the highest quality ingredients available. Our beer is hand-crafted in beautiful Bridgman, MI, just one mile from Lake Michigan. Our taproom features 20 taps as well as an artisan menu and a relaxing beer garden for sunny summer days. We also distribute in kegs throughout Southern and Western Michigan. Look for our beers in the Grand Rapids, Kalamazoo, Lansing and Ann Arbor markets. We are passionate about craft beer. Tapistry Brewing—combining artistry and chemistry.

breweries.name: Altamont Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Brewer Gordon Kear, former brewer for Flagstaff Brewing Company for the past six years, and business partner Ben Wiggins wanted to bring more coolness to West Asheville. Their way of doing it, build a brewing company and bar with all the best Asheville has to offer. Known locally as “the bar”, the Altamont boasts a wide open floor plan with regulation ping-pong, a foosball table and single disc-golf basket. The place hosts a variety of musicians and dj’s weekly plus open mic-night every tuesday. While the brewing facility is still a work-in-progress, the Altamont has some of the finest locals on tap.

We're here make great beer people enjoy and provide a great place for drinking it! The Altamont is not your average bar. Kayaks are stored behind the bar, cyclists can ride right in, and dogs lounge around, asking for pretzel handouts.

data.name: Battle Axe Blonde Ale
data.description:
Brewed mainly with 2-row barley and a very light accent of Cascade & Chinook hops, this is our lightest brew.


It has a golden hue, and easily our most popular beer.

breweries.name: Dempsey's Brewpub
breweries.description:
Cead Mile Failte! Dempseys Brewery Restaurant & Pub

 We are a local family owned restaurant, with an on-site micro-brewery (2nd oldest in the state!) and we have been in business for over 15 years! 

We specialize in european/american style food, with about 85% of all of our items made from scratch. Executive Chef Se'an Dempsey is also the only Certified Pizzioloia in South Dakota, as a recent graduate of the Scullo Italiana Pizzaioli in San Francisco.

We also feature the ONLY Brick Oven in Watertown!

breweries.name: Chocolay River Brewery
breweries.description:
The Chocolay River Brewery, located inside The Bayou Restaurant at 200 West Main Street in Harvey, makes beer. Good beer. Not only does our beer taste good but it also makes your meal better.
 
We believe that our flavorful beers enrich the life, tradition and the culture of our community. While striving to brew the best beer possible (and make time for our families), The Chocolay River Brewery promotes the proliferation of good beer and good food whenever it can.

breweries.name: Assawoman Bay Brewing Company
breweries.description: Assawoman Bay (local /ˈæsəwʊmən/), once called Assawoman Sound, is a lagoon that is located between Ocean City, Maryland and mainland Delmarva. The name comes from the Algonquian Indians who originally lived here.

breweries.name: 3 Daughters Brewing
breweries.description: 3 Daughters Brewing will be opening fall of 2013 with several exciting new craft beers. With our 30 barrel brewhouse, we will have the capacity to serve the Tampa Bay market new and innovative flavors in our Beach Blonde Ale, Brown Pelican Dunkelweizen and Summer Storm Stout. Keep an eye out for the 3DB brand in your local restaurant and stay tuned for the opening of our tasting room coming soon.

breweries.name: Union Brewing Company
breweries.description: At Union Brewing Company, our artisan ales are hand crafted two barrels at a time using time honored traditions, natural ingredients and traditional methods. Our beers are never filtered or force carbonated. They condition and carbonate naturally in casks and are hand drawn by authentic beer engines at the perfect drinking temperature to maximize all the flavors. (No, they are not warm!) We really like beer, and we love cask conditioned real ales. We think you will too!

Bulldog Brewery is a family owned and operated brewery & tap room located at Jefferson and Date Streets in Murrieta, CA.

We start our brewing process with the freshest ingredients to produce consistent, top quality, craft beer. Bulldog Brewery also offers a perfectly matched food menu served in our comfortable tasting room.
Bulldog Brewery offers great beers, food, local wines and a unique experience.

data.name: Bean Flicker Blonde

breweries.name: Odd Side Ales
breweries.description: ​Welcome to Odd Side Ales, one of the fastest growing breweries in Michigan. Born in an old piano factory in downtown Grand Haven, Michigan, Odd Side Ales first opened its doors in March 2010. We've grown steadily since that first brew, but have never lost sight of our initial goal: to create a variety of complex beers, each with its own unique flavor. To that end, we strive to craft unusual beers that will make your taste buds dance. Whether you're looking for the perfect IPA or something ... just a little different, we've got the beer for you.

data.description: Light golden in color with mildly sweet honey-malt like aroma and a crisp dry finish characterize this perfect session ale. Refreshing and light make this beer perfect for a sunny day on our patio with some friends and a couple of our unique appetizers.

breweries.name: Tamarack Brewing Company
breweries.description: Tamarack is nestled beneath the Rocky and Mission Mountains in Lakeside, Montana, near the shores of beautiful Flathead Lake. High ceilings, fascinating architectural details and a warm ambience help make The 'Rack the best spot in the Flathead Valley to relax with great food and handcrafted ales. The creek side patio is the perfect place to hang out and enjoy the outdoors with friends and family. Tamarack is proud to be a casual brew pub where people can enjoy simple yet wonderful pub fare and ales in an unassuming and friendly atmosphere.

data.name: Beatnik Blonde
data.description: Blonde ales come in all different shapes, sizes, and (ahem) levels of drinkability…Three Pints’ Beatnik Blonde strays from the beaten path of other American ales, infusing Saaz hops with subtle maltiness to deliver a golden beer with a delicious message: Drink outside the box…Craft beer awaits. IBU: 27.8. Tastiness Level: Blonde is Beautiful.

breweries.name: Golden Valley Brewery
breweries.description:
Best Brew Pub in the Heart of Wine Country!

Since we started in 1993, we've followed a fresh, local, made-in-house cuisine program at Golden Valley.

We've always had our own kitchen garden supplying the restaurant, and sourced fresh vegetables, fruits, meat, fish and poultry from local producers whenever possible.

Our chef Greg Meixner orchestrates the procurement of fresh, healthy, great tasting foods for you and your family.

Everyone knows the rich, fresh and natural taste of our beef but few realize how we do it.

Since 2003, GVB owners Peter & Celia Kircher have also owned and operated the Angus Springs Ranch on 76 acres of rolling spring fed pastures outside McMinnville.

Golden Valley Brewery grain makes ideal feed for our select Black Angus herd because it contains twice the protein and fiber of regular feed. 

Our Angus are raised on an all natural program of spring fed pastures and premium rations for up to 12 months and then dry aged for 21 days insuring beef of exceptional quality and tenderness.

No hormones, antibiotic feeds, or animal by products are used in the production of our beef. 

Our goal is to produce the finest all natural beef in the Northwest!

breweries.name: Track 7 Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Graham and Scott families established Track 7 Brewing Company as an outlet for creative expression through unique and artisanal beers. The name, Track 7 Brewing Company, was selected in part due to the brewery’s proximity to the old Western Pacific railroad tracks, west of Curtis Park, and as a nod to the integral role the railroad has and continues to play in Sacramento’s rich history.

Track 7's approach to beer is in the vein of the firmly-hopped West Coast tradition, but without fidelity to a singular “style”. This unfocused approach allows Track 7 to experiment with all varieties of beer, regardless of American, Belgian, English, or German inspiration.

breweries.name: Below the Radar Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Below the Radar is Huntsville’s first Micro-Brewhouse situated in the Historic Huntsville Times Building in the recently stablished “downtown entertainment district”. Below the Radar opened its doors on August 2012 and has been expanding its lunch and dinner menu of goodness as well as its micro-brews & drinks ever since.Below the Radar is a great place to have lunch or meet after work for socializing with friends and co-workers. BTR is known for its one of a kind variety of micro-brews, extensive wine list and liquor drinks or its wonder array of food by its own in-house Chef Bill Harden. BTR menu items include like roast beef sliders topped with cilantro-horseradish sauce. And how about some Lazy Magnolia Southern Pecan Ice Cream for dessert!
Enjoy live music every Tesday night to make it a night to remember.

BTR is open 7 days a week for lunch & dinner (including a very special “Chef Bill Brunch” on Sundays). Be sure to check out the Chef Dish Pick of the Week.

BTR has thirty-two beers on tap including 7 craft brews made in-house, more than 27 bottled beers.

BTR has a Full bar and a great selection of fine wines. Be sure to check our Wine Pick of the Week.

An upscale, yet relaxed, and nonsmoking atmosphere.

data.name: Beer of the Gods
data.description: Light and refreshing, our cheeky flagship German-style beer is low in alcohol and easy to drink, but has enough hop bitterness to please even Zeus himself. Sure, we know those well-endowed beers will get all the press, but, just once, how about some props for the little guy?

breweries.name: High & Mighty Beer Company
breweries.description:
High & Mighty Beer Company began in 2006 as an offshoot of Shelton Brothers beer importing company. Will Shelton took his idea for a novel German-style ale to Paper City Brewery in Holyoke, Massachusetts, and Beer of the Gods was born, to extraordinary commercial success, critical acclaim, and unabashed adoration from beer geeks the world over.

Eventually, Will discovered that he enjoyed selling the beer he made even more than he did the splendid beers that Shelton Brothers imports, and in June 2008, he abandoned his brother to focus on making American beer that added an American attitude to the best of European beer styles. The beer is still lovingly made at Paper City, but look for High & Mighty to open a brewery of its own in 2010.

breweries.name: Begyle Brewing
breweries.description:
Begyle Brewing is a Community Supported Brewery, located in the Ravenswood Industrial Corridor, Chicago, IL.

Using a CSA (community supported agriculture) model, we will supply beer to our members via monthly subscriptions (referred to as a CSB or Beer-CSA!). In addition to the growler subscriptions we will offer growler fills to walk up customers through our retail space, as well as kegs and bottle for sale. We source many of our hops locally, you can expect the majority of our beers to include locally grown hops from Wisconsin and Michigan. We have lots of other things up our sleeves, too, like using spent grain for dog treats and sharing our space with local artists.

breweries.name: Ozark Beer Company
breweries.description: We strive to make great beer. Beer that speaks to the quality and character of who we are and also to the region that we represent. We are proud to be in the Ozark Mountains, with its relaxed atmosphere and eclectic population of farmers, craftsmen, and captains of industry. At Ozark Beer Company, we make beer that brings neighbors together, and that all people lucky enough to call the Ozarks home can be proud of.

data.name: Belgoo Luppo
data.description:
Belgoo Luppo is a top fermented dry hopping blond ale made with barley and oats.

It is a 100% natural, non-filtered beer without any spices, with prounounced grapefruit and passion fruit aromas from the used hops. It has a bitterness of 34 IBU.

Like all Belgoo beers, it gets a last fermentation in the bottle by adding yeast just before bottling.

No sugars are added during the brewing process.
data.foodPairings: Belgoo Luppo  is ideal as aperitif because of it's dry character and accompanies perfectly seafood and salades.

data.description: Our All-American blonde is light bodied yet full-flavored. Dry maltiness, subtle hop character, and a hint of honey yield a fresh, satisfying taste. Pale and Carapil malts, three stages of hops, and mounds of pure honey combine to produce an unforgettable experience time and again.

breweries.name: Belle Isle Restaurant and Brewing Co
breweries.description: The Belle Isle Restaurant & Brewery, located in the heart of Northwest Oklahoma City, is a favorite for lunch, dinner and entertainment. Enjoy a menu of pastas, burgers, pizzas, and more. Then there's the Beer! We at the Belle Isle Brewery are proud to create the finest handcrafted beer available, using the best ingredients and strict German Brewing rules. We've developed an excellent selection of beers now available for take out. Our pub features a daily happy hour and live music.

data.name: Bellingham Blonde
data.description: A straight forward lighter bodied ale, our Blonde was brewed for the Summertime. It has a well rounded softness with a crisp, cleansing finish.

breweries.name: Boundary Bay Brewery
breweries.description:
The Boundary Bay approach to beer is to render excellent examples of classic styles. In some cases--such as with our IPA, Imperial IPA and Imperial Oatmeal Stout--we push the envelope and make a very big and flavorful brew. Put simply, we brew the beers that we like to drink! 

We are located in the heart of downtown Bellingham, WA and have been dubbed "Pure Bellingham" by the locals!  We continually win awards for our beer, have been named one of the top 25 breweries in the U.S. (by Steve Johnson, America's Best Brews), were declared the Best Brewery in WA (by the Northwest Brewing News Reader's Poll 2005, 2008, 2009 and 2010) and are the only brewery in Washington to bring home the Alpha King award for our Imperial IPA.

Come have a pint with us.  Cheers!
